abstract.t: This memo concerns dropping or marking packets using active queue management (AQM) such as random early detection (RED) or pre- congestion notification (PCN). We give two strong recommendations: (1) packet size should not be taken into account when transports read congestion indications, not when network equipment writes them, and (2) byte-mode packet drop variant of AQM algorithms, such as RED, should not be used to drop fewer small packets.
